text: Azealia Amanda Banks (born May 31, 1991) is an American rapper, singer, and songwriter. She was born in Harlem, New York City. On November 9, 2008 she made a Myspace account and released her first song, "Gimme a Chance" on it as "Miss Bank$". Later that year she was signed by XL Recordings. In 2011 Banks was chosen by NME as No.1 of their Cool List of the year. Her first album Broke with Expensive Taste is going to be released in January 2014. Her second album, Fantasea II: The Second Wave is going to be released July 2013. On December 6, 2011 Banks' first single "212" was released. On May 28, 2012 her first EP 1991 was released in the UK. It was released in the US the next day. A video for the song "Van Vogue" was released. On July 11, 2012 a 19-song mixtape called Fantasea was released for free download. Banks' second single "Esta Noche" was going to be released September 25, 2012, but a day before this was cancelled because the producer Munchi said she "stole" the track. On December 4, 2012 the single "Liquorice" was released. Banks made a dark purple lipstick with MAC called "Yung Rapunxel". It was marketed online from September 6 to 20, 2012.http://www.blackbookmag.com/azealia-banks-gets-her- own-mac-lipstick-1.52251 On January 10, 2014 Banks released a remix of "Partition" by Beyonc√© Knowles she made with Busta Rhymes. ==Personal life== Banks is bisexual. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:Rappers from New York (state) Category:African-American rappers Category:Actors from New York City Category:American electronic musicians Category:American hip hop singers Category:American record producers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Bisexual people Category:LGBT African-Americans Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT people from New York (state) Category:LGBT singers Category:LGBT songwriters Category:Movie actors Category:People from Harlem Category:Singers from New York City
title: Azealia Banks
